    "assume that @xmath0 is generated by the arma ",
    "garch model @xmath1 where @xmath2 @xmath3 @xmath4 , and @xmath5 is a sequence of i.i.d . random variables with @xmath6 . as we all know",
    ", since @xcite and @xcite , model ( [ 11])([12 ] ) has been widely used in economics and finance ; see @xcite , @xcite , @xcite and @xcite . the asymptotic theory of the quasi - maximum likelihood estimator ( qmle ) was established by @xcite and by @xcite when @xmath7 . under the strict stationarity condition ,",
    "the consistency and the asymptotic normality of the qmle were obtained by @xcite and @xcite for the garch@xmath8 model , and by @xcite and @xcite for the garch@xmath9 model .",
    "@xcite established the asymptotic theory of the qmle for the garch model when @xmath10 , including both cases in which @xmath11 and @xmath12 . under the geometric ergodicity condition",
    ", @xcite gave the asymptotic properties of the modified qmle for the first order ar  arch model .",
    "moreover , when @xmath13 for some @xmath14 , the asymptotic theory of the global self - weighted qmle and the local qmle was established by @xcite for model  .",
    "it is well known that the asymptotic normality of the qmle requires @xmath15 and this property is lost when @xmath16 ; see @xcite .",
    "usually , the least absolute deviation ( lad ) approach can be used to reduce the moment condition of @xmath17 and provide a robust estimator .",
    "the local lad estimator was studied by @xcite and @xcite for the pure garch model , @xcite for the double ar(1 ) model , and @xcite for the arfima  garch model .",
    "the global lad estimator was studied by @xcite for the pure arch model and by @xcite for the pure garch model , and by @xcite for the double ar(@xmath18 ) model . except for",
    "the ar models studied by davis , knight and liu ( @xcite ) and @xcite [ see also knight ( @xcite , @xcite ) ] , the nondifferentiable and nonconvex objective function appears when one studies the lad estimator for the arma model with i.i.d .",
    "errors . by assuming the existence of a @xmath19-consistent estimator",
    ", the asymptotic normality of the lad estimator is established for the arma model with i.i.d .",
    "errors by @xcite for the finite variance case and by @xcite for the infinite variance case ; see also wu and davis ( @xcite ) for the noncausal or noninvertible arma model .",
    "recently , @xcite proved the asymptotic normality of the global lad estimator for the finite / infinite variance arma model with i.i.d .",
    "errors .    in this paper",
    ", we investigate the self - weighted quasi - maximum exponential likelihood estimator ( qmele ) for model ( [ 11])([12 ] ) . under only a fractional moment condition of @xmath20 with @xmath21 , the strong consistency and the asymptotic normality of the global self - weighted qmele",
    "are obtained by using the bracketing method in @xcite .",
    "based on this global self - weighted qmele , the local qmele is showed to be asymptotically normal for the arma ",
    "garch ( finite variance ) and igarch models .",
    "a formal comparison of two estimators is given for some cases .",
    "for @xmath22 . ]",
    "to motivate our estimation procedure , we revisit the gnp deflator example of @xcite , in which the garch model was proposed for the first time .",
    "the model he specified is an ar(4)garch@xmath8 model for the quarterly data from 1948.2 to 1983.4 with a total of 143 observations .",
    "we use this data set and his fitted model to obtain the residuals @xmath23 .",
    "the tail index of @xmath24 is estimated by hill s estimator @xmath25 with the largest @xmath26 data of @xmath27 , that is , @xmath28 where @xmath29 is the @xmath30th order statistic of @xmath27 .",
    "the plot of @xmath31 is given in figure  [ figure1 ] . from this figure",
    ", we can see that @xmath32 when @xmath33 , and @xmath34 when @xmath35 .",
    "note that hill s estimator is not so reliable when  @xmath26 is too small .",
    "thus , the tail of @xmath24 is most likely less than 2 , that is , @xmath16 .",
    "thus , the setup that @xmath17 has a finite forth moment may not be suitable , and hence the standard qmle procedure may not be reliable in this case .",
    "the estimation procedure in this paper only requires @xmath21 .",
    "it may provide a more reliable alternative to practitioners . to further illustrate this advantage ,",
    "a simulation study is carried out to compare the performance of our estimators and the self - weighted / local qmle in @xcite , and a  new real example on the world crude oil price is given in this paper .",
    "this paper is organized as follows .",
    "section [ sec2 ] gives our results on the global self - weighted qmele .",
    "section [ sec3 ] proposes a local qmele estimator and gives its limiting distribution .",
    "the simulation results are reported in section  [ sec4 ] .",
    "a real example is given in section [ sec5 ] .",
    "the proofs of two technical lemmas are provided in section [ sec6 ] .",
    "concluding remarks are offered in section  [ sec7 ] .",
    "the remaining proofs are given in the .",

    "assumption [ asm23 ] is necessary to ensure that @xmath70 is not almost surely ( a.s . ) a  constant .",

    "the self - weighted qmele in section [ sec2 ] reduces the moment condition of @xmath85 , but it may not be efficient . in this section , we propose a local qmele based on the self - weighted qmele and derive its asymptotic property .",

    ".    under assumption [ asm31 ] , there exists a unique strictly stationary causal solution to garch model ( [ 12 ] ) ; see @xcite and @xcite .",
    "the condition @xmath205 is necessary and sufficient for @xmath206 under which model ( [ 12 ] ) has a finite variance . when @xmath207 , model ( [ 12 ] ) is called igarch model .",

    "lemma [ lemma31 ] , we have that @xmath216^{-1 } \\biggl[{\\frac}{1}{n}t_n^{*}(\\hat{\\theta}_{sn})\\biggr]\\\\ & = & \\hat{\\theta}_{sn}-[2\\sigma+o_p(1)]^{-1 } \\biggl\\{{\\frac}{1}{n}t_n^{*}(\\theta _ 0)+[2\\sigma+o_p(1)](\\hat{\\theta}_{sn}-\\theta_0)+o_p\\biggl({\\frac}{1}{\\sqrt{n}}\\biggr)\\biggr\\ } \\\\ & = & \\theta_0+{\\frac}{\\sigma^{-1}t_n^{*}(\\theta_0)}{2n}+o_p\\biggl({\\frac}{1}{\\sqrt{n}}\\biggr).\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] it follows that @xmath217 by lemma [ lemma31](iii ) , we can see that the conclusion holds .",

    "we now compare the asymptotic efficiency of the local qmele and the self - weighted qmele .",
    "first , we consider the pure arma model , that is , model ( [ 11])([12 ] ) with @xmath224 being a constant . in this case , @xmath225 where @xmath226 .",
    "let b and c be two any @xmath227-dimensional constant vectors .",
    "then , @xmath228\\bigr\\}^2\\\\ & \\leq & e\\bigl(c'\\sqrt{g(0)}w_tx_{1t}\\bigr)^2e\\bigl(\\sqrt{g(0)}x_{1t}'b\\bigr)^2\\\\ & = & [ c'g(0)\\omega_0c][b'\\sigma b]=c'[g(0)\\omega_0b'\\sigma b]c.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] thus , @xmath229 ( a positive semi - definite matrix ) and hence @xmath230 .",
    "it follows that @xmath231^{-1}=\\sigma^{-1}\\omega\\sigma^{-1}$ ] .",
    "thus , the local qmele is more efficient than the self - weighted qmele .",
    "similarly , we can show that the local qmele is more efficient than the self - weighted qmele for the pure garch model .    for the general model ( [ 11])([12 ] )",
    ", it is not easy to compare the asymptotic efficiency of the self - weighted qmele and the local qmele .",
    "however , when @xmath98 , we have @xmath232 where @xmath233 .",
    "then , it is easy to see that @xmath234\\ } ^2\\\\ & & \\qquad\\leq\\bigl\\{\\sqrt{e(c'2^{-1/4}w_tx_{1t})^2e(2^{-3/4}x_{1t}'b)^2}\\\\ & & \\qquad\\quad\\hspace*{4pt}{}+\\sqrt { e(c'2^{-5/4}w_tx_{2t})^2e(2^{-7/4}x_{2t}'b)^2}\\bigr\\}^2\\\\ & & \\qquad\\leq [ e(c'2^{-1/4}w_tx_{1t})^2+e(c'2^{-5/4}w_tx_{2t})^2]\\\\ & & \\qquad\\quad{}\\times[e(2^{-3/4}x_{1t}'b)^2+e(2^{-7/4}x_{2t}'b)^2]\\\\ & & \\qquad=[c'2^{-1/2}\\omega_0c][b'2^{-1/2}\\sigma b]=c'[2^{-1}\\omega_0b'\\sigma b]c.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] thus , @xmath235 and hence @xmath236 .",
    "it follows that @xmath237 .",

    "in this section , we compare the performance of the global self - weighted qmele ( @xmath83 ) , the global self - weighted qmle ( @xmath274 ) , the local qmele @xmath275 and the local qmle @xmath276 .",
    "the following ar(1)garch@xmath8 model is used to generate data samples : @xmath277\\\\[-8pt ] { \\varepsilon}_t&=&\\eta_t\\sqrt{h_t } \\quad\\mbox{and}\\quad h_t=\\alpha_0+\\alpha_1{\\varepsilon}_{t-1}^2+\\beta_1h_{t-1}.\\nonumber \\ ] ] we set the sample size @xmath278 and use @xmath279 replications , and study the cases when @xmath5 has @xmath280 , @xmath281 and @xmath282 distribution . for the case with @xmath283 ( i.e. , @xmath284 ) , we take @xmath285 . for the igarch case ( i.e. , @xmath286 ) , we take @xmath287 when @xmath98 , @xmath288 when @xmath289 and @xmath290 when @xmath291 .",
    "we standardize the distribution of  @xmath5 to ensure that @xmath116 for the qmele .",
    "tables [ table1][table3 ] list the sample biases , the sample standard deviations ( sd ) and the asymptotic standard deviations ( ad ) of @xmath292 , @xmath195 and @xmath293 .",
    "we choose @xmath81 as in ( [ 24 ] ) with @xmath107 being 90% quantile of @xmath108 and @xmath294 for @xmath295 .",
    "the ads in theorems  [ theorem22 ] and [ theorem31 ] are estimated by @xmath296 and @xmath297 , respectively , where @xmath298    from table [ table1 ] , when @xmath98 , we can see that the self - weighted qmele has smaller ad and sd than those of both the self - weighted qmle and the local qmle .",
    "when @xmath289 , in table [ table2 ] , we can see that the self - weighted qmle has smaller ad and sd than those of both the self - weighted qmele and the local qmele . from table",
    "[ table3 ] , we note that the sd and ad of both the self - weighted qmle and the local qmle are not close to each other since their asymptotic variances are infinite , while the sd and ad of the self - weighted qmele and the local qmele are very close to each other . except @xmath299 in table [ table3 ] , we can see that all four estimators in tables [ table1][table3 ] have very small biases , and the local qmele and local qmle always have the smaller sd and ad than those of the self - weighted qmele and self - weighted qmle , respectively .",
    "this conclusion holds no matter with garch errors ( finite variance ) or igarch errors .",
    "this coincides with what we expected .",
    "thus , if the tail index of the data is greater than 2 but @xmath11 , we suggest to use the local qmele in practice ; see also @xcite for a  discussion .",
    "overall , the simulation results show that the self - weighted qmele and the local qmele have a good performance in the finite sample , especially for the heavy - tailed innovations .",
    "in this section , we study the weekly world crude oil price ( dollars per barrel ) from january 3 , 1997 to august 6 , 2010 , which has in total 710 observations ; see figure [ figure3](a ) .",
    "its 100 times log - return , denoted by @xmath300 , is plotted in figure [ figure3](b ) .",
    "the classic method based on the akaike s information criterion ( aic ) leads to the following model : @xmath301\\\\[-8pt ] & & ( 0.0357 ) \\hspace*{24pt}(0.0357)\\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where the standard errors are in parentheses , and the estimated value of @xmath302 is 16.83 . model ( [ 51 ] ) is stationary , and none of the first ten autocorrelations or partial autocorrelations of the residuals @xmath303 are significant at the 5% level .",
    "however , looking at the autocorrelations of @xmath304 , it turns out that the 1st , 2nd and 8th all exceed two asymptotic standard errors ; see figure [ figure4](a ) .",
    "similar results hold for the partial autocorrelations of @xmath304 in figure [ figure4](b ) .",
    "this shows that @xmath305 may be highly correlated , and hence there may exist arch effects .",
    "[ cols=\"^,^ \" , ]     finally , we estimate the tail index of @xmath306 in model ( [ 52 ] ) by using hill s estimator @xmath25 with @xmath307 , base on @xmath27 .",
    "the plot of @xmath308 is given in figure [ figure7 ] , from     for @xmath27 of model ( [ 52 ] ) . ]    which we can see that @xmath309 is most likely finite , but  @xmath310 is infinite .",
    "furthermore , the estimator of @xmath309 is @xmath311 , and it turns out that @xmath312 .",
    "this means that .",
    "therefore , all the assumptions of theorem [ theorem31 ] are most likely satisfied .",
    "in particular , the estimated tail indices of @xmath313 and @xmath27 show the evidence that the self - weighted / local qmele is necessary in modeling the crude oil price .",

    "\\leq & \\delta_kce(w_t^2\\xi_{\\rho t-1}^{3}).\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] since @xmath372 $ ] is a martingale difference sequence , by the previous inequality , it follows that @xmath373&=&{\\frac}{1}{n}\\sum_{t=1}^n e\\ { f^{+}_t(u_i)-e[f^{+}_t(u_i)|\\mathcal{f}_{t-1 } ] \\}^2 \\nonumber\\\\ & \\leq&{\\frac}{1}{n } \\sum_{t=1}^n e[(f^{+}_t(u_i))^2 ] \\nonumber\\\\[-8pt]\\\\[-8pt ] & \\leq&{\\frac}{\\delta_k}{n } \\sum_{t=1}^n ce(w_t^2\\xi_{\\rho t-1}^{3 } ) \\nonumber \\\\ & \\equiv&\\pi_n(\\delta_k).\\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] thus , by ( [ 65 ] ) and ( [ 66 ] ) , we have @xmath374 by a similar argument , we can get the same bound for the lower tail .",

    "this completes all of the proofs .",
    "in this paper , we first propose a self - weighted qmele for the arma  garch model .",
    "the strong consistency and asymptotic normality of the global self - weighted qmele are established under a  fractional moment condition of @xmath438 with @xmath21 .",
    "based on this estimator , the local qmele is showed to be asymptotically normal for the arma ",
    "garch ( finite variance ) and igarch models .",
    "the empirical study shows that the self - weighted / local qmele has a better performance than the self - weighted / local qmle when @xmath17 has a heavy - tailed distribution , while the local qmele is more efficient than the self - weighted qmele for the cases with a finite variance and igarch errors .",
    "we also give a real example to illustrate that our new estimation procedure is necessary . according to our limit experience",
    ", the estimated tail index of most of data sets lies in @xmath439 in economics and finance .",
    "thus , the local qmele may be the most suitable in practice if there is a further evidence to show that @xmath16 .",
    "the lemma [ lemmaa1 ] below is from @xcite .",
    "[ lemmaa1 ] let @xmath440 be defined as in assumption [ asm24 ] .",
    "if assumptions  [ asm21 ] and  [ asm22 ] hold , then there exists a constant @xmath441 and a neighborhood  @xmath442 of @xmath92 such that : @xmath443    [ lemmaa2 ] for any @xmath444 , let @xmath445 be an open neighborhood of @xmath446 with radius @xmath323 . if assumptions [ asm21][asm25 ] hold , then : @xmath447<\\infty,\\\\ & & \\mbox{\\hphantom{i}\\textup{(ii)}\\quad } e[w_tl_t(\\theta ) ] \\qquad\\mbox{has a unique minimum at } \\theta_0,\\\\ & & \\mbox{\\textup{(iii)}\\quad } e\\bigl[\\sup_{\\theta\\in b_\\eta(\\theta^*)}w_t|l_t(\\theta)-l_t(\\theta^*)|\\bigr]\\to0 \\qquad\\mbox{as } \\eta\\to0.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    first , by ( a.13 ) and ( a.14 ) in @xcite and assumptions  [ asm24 ] and  [ asm25 ] , it follows that @xmath448\\leq ce[w_t\\xi_{\\rho t-1}(1+|\\eta_t|)]<\\infty\\ ] ] for some @xmath87 , and @xmath449<\\infty;\\ ] ] see ling ( @xcite ) , page 864 .",
    "thus , ( i ) holds .",
    "next , by a direct calculation , we have @xmath450&=&e\\biggl[w_t\\log\\sqrt{h_t(\\theta)}+\\frac{w_t|{\\varepsilon}_t(\\gamma _ 0)+(\\gamma-\\gamma_0)'({{\\partial}{\\varepsilon}_t(\\xi^*)}/{{\\partial}\\theta})|}{\\sqrt{h_t(\\theta ) } } \\biggr]\\\\ & = & e\\biggl[w_t\\log\\sqrt{h_t(\\theta)}+\\frac{w_t}{\\sqrt{h_t(\\theta)}}e\\biggl\\{\\!\\biggl|{\\varepsilon}_t(\\gamma_0)+(\\gamma-\\gamma_0)'\\,{\\frac}{{\\partial}{\\varepsilon}_t(\\xi^*)}{{\\partial}\\theta}\\biggr|\\big|\\mathcal { f}_{t-1}\\!\\biggr\\}\\!\\biggr]\\\\ & \\geq & e\\biggl[w_t\\log\\!\\sqrt{h_t(\\theta)}+\\frac{w_t}{\\sqrt{h_t(\\theta)}}e(|{\\varepsilon}_t||\\mathcal{f}_{t-1})\\biggr]\\\\ & = & e\\biggl[w_t\\biggl(\\log\\sqrt{{\\frac}{h_t(\\theta)}{h_t(\\theta_0)}}+\\sqrt{{\\frac}{h_t(\\theta",
    "_ 0)}{h_t(\\theta)}}\\biggr)\\biggr]+e \\bigl[w_t\\log\\sqrt{h_t(\\theta_0)}\\bigr],\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where the last inequality holds since @xmath5 has a unique median 0 , and obtains the minimum if and only if @xmath451 a.s . ;",
    "see @xcite . here",

    "third , let @xmath459 .",
    "for any @xmath460 , using taylor s expansion , we can see that @xmath461 where @xmath462 lies between @xmath463 and @xmath464 . by lemma [ lemmaa1](iii)(iv ) and",
    "assumption  [ asm24 ] , for some @xmath465 , we have @xmath466\\leq c\\eta e(w_t\\xi_{\\rho t-1})\\rightarrow0\\ ] ] as @xmath467 . similarly , @xmath468&\\rightarrow&0 \\qquad\\mbox{as } \\eta\\rightarrow 0,\\\\ e\\biggl[\\sup_{\\theta\\in b_{\\eta}(\\theta^ * ) } w_t|{\\varepsilon}_t(\\gamma^*)|\\biggl|{\\frac}{1}{\\sqrt{h_t(\\theta)}}-{\\frac}{1}{\\sqrt{h_t(\\theta ^*)}}\\biggr|\\biggr]&\\rightarrow & 0\\qquad \\mbox{as } \\eta\\rightarrow0.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] then , it follows that ( iii ) holds .",
    "this completes all of the proofs of lemma  [ lemmaa2 ] .",
    "proof of theorem [ theorem21 ] we use the method in @xcite .",
    "let @xmath469 be any open neighborhood of @xmath470 .",
    "by lemma [ lemmaa2](iii ) , for any @xmath471 and @xmath333 , there exists an @xmath472 such that @xmath473 \\geq e[w_tl_t(\\theta^*)]-{\\varepsilon}.\\ ] ] from lemma [ lemmaa2](i ) , by the ergodic theorem , it follows that @xmath474-{\\varepsilon}\\ ] ] as @xmath411 is large enough .",

    "thus , from ( [ a1 ] ) and ( [ a2 ] ) , we have @xmath477-{\\varepsilon}\\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] as @xmath411 is large enough .",
    "note that the infimum on the compact set @xmath475 is attained . for each @xmath478 , from lemma [ lemmaa2](ii )",
    ", there exists an @xmath479 such that @xmath480\\geq e[w_t l_t(\\theta_0)]+3{\\varepsilon}_0.\\ ] ] thus , from ( [ a3 ] ) and ( [ a4 ] ) , taking @xmath481 , it follows that @xmath482 + 2{\\varepsilon}_0.\\ ] ] on the other hand , by the ergodic theorem , it follows that @xmath483+{\\varepsilon}_0.\\ ] ] hence , combining ( [ a5 ] ) and ( [ a6 ] ) , it gives us @xmath484 + 2{\\varepsilon}_0>e[w_t l_t(\\theta_0)]+{\\varepsilon}_0\\geq\\inf_{\\theta\\in v } l_{sn}(\\theta),\\ ] ] which implies that @xmath485 by the arbitrariness of @xmath469 , it yields @xmath486 a.s .",
    "this completes the proof .",
    "the authors greatly appreciate the very helpful comments of two anonymous referees , the associate editor and the editor t.  tony , cai ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> this paper investigates the asymptotic theory of the quasi - maximum exponential likelihood estimators ( qmele ) for arma  garch models . under only a fractional moment condition , </S>",
    "<S> the strong consistency and the asymptotic normality of the global self - weighted qmele are obtained . </S>",
    "<S> based on this self - weighted qmele , the local qmele is showed to be asymptotically normal for the arma model with garch ( finite variance ) and igarch errors . </S>",
    "<S> a formal comparison of two estimators is given for some cases . </S>",
    "<S> a simulation study is carried out to assess the performance of these estimators , and a real example on the world crude oil price is given .    and    .    . </S>"
  ]
}
